headline.main: THE ELM-STREET FIRE.; Scene at the Ruins--A List of the Wounded and Missing. TENEMENT BUILDING MAN-TRAPS.

headline.main: Another Expulsion from Kentucky.; MORE ANTI-SLAVERY MEN BANISHED-MOB LAW ENFORCED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the persons lately expelled from Berea, Madison County, Ky., having manifested an intention of taking up their abodes in Bracken and Lewis Counties, strong manifestations of displeasure have been exhibited by a portion of the inhabitants of those localities. The excitement has been growing more intense for a week or two past, and at last found its rent in meetings.

headline.main: AMERICAN CITIZENS ABROAD.; THE OUTRAGE AT PERUGIA. Message and Documents.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following interesting correspondence has just been sent in to the Senate in compliance with the resolution of Mr. SUMNER, of Massachusetts, calling upon the President for information in regard to the outrage perpetrated upon an American family in the Pontifical States, at the attack and capture of Perugia:

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. THE MAYOR'S NOMINATIONS FOR CROTON AQUEDUCT COMMISSIONER AND HEALTH COMMISSIONER--THE FIRST REJECTED AND THE LASTREFERRED--A FIERCE DISCUSSION--HEALTHWARDENS APPOINTED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Alderman RUSSELL, last evening, presented to the Board of Aldermen a resolution directing that the obstructions in Gouverneur-slip be removed forthwith, and that the slip be dredged and put in suitable condition for commercial purposes. It was adopted.

docs.snippet: CHARLESTOWN, Va., Wednesday, Feb. 1 The town is thronged to-day to witness the pro  ceedings of the trial of STEPHENS, one of the Harper's Ferry conspirators.

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; THE HARPER'S FERRY INSURGENTS. Trial of Stephens and Hazlett at Charlestown.
